titleStmt.title: Recognition-based Segmentation of On-line Cursive Handwriting

analytic.title: Recognition-based Segmentation of On-line Cursive Handwriting

abstract.p: This paper introduces a new recognition-based segmentation approach to recognizing on-line cursive handwriting from a database of 10,000 English words. The original input stream of z, y pen coordinates is encoded as a sequence of uniform stroke descriptions that are processed by six feed-forward neural-networks, each designed to recognize letters of different sizes. Words are then recognized by performing best-first search over the space of all possible segmen-tations. Results demonstrate that the method is effective at both writer dependent recognition (1.7% to 15.5% error rate) and writer independent recognition (5.2% to 31.1% error rate).
